Articles.Content:
How do I edit the time in my game? I want to put my save back 30 years (I spent that time on time warp watching asteroids get encounters with Kerbin). I feel cheap that so much time passed, with nothing happening.

Can Hyperedit do this? Or do I have to save edit?

Edited December 4, 2014 by Engineer Of Stuff
I've done the same without ever giving that a second thought. I have no idea how to revert it. Does that really matter/have an impact on the game?

Edit the persistence file. Should be one first lines.

I just closed down my KSP computer, or I'd find you the exact line to change. It's actually pretty simple.

Something like UT = 123456789.0

Edited December 2, 2014 by EdFred

Something like UT = 123456789.0

KSP\saves\...\*.sfs

...

FLIGHTSTATE

{

version = 0.22.0

UT = 19.2599999999997

activeVessel = 0
